00179    virtual void
00180    initializeLevelData(const Pointer<BasePatchHierarchy<NDIM> > hierarchy,
00181                        const int level_number,
00182                        const double time,
00183                        const bool can_be_refined,
00184                        const bool initial_time,
00185                        const Pointer<BasePatchLevel<NDIM> > old_level = 
00186                              Pointer<BasePatchLevel<NDIM> >(NULL),
00187                        const bool allocate_data = true);
00188 
00189    /*!*
00190     * After hierarchy levels have changed and data has been initialized on 
00191     * the new levels, this routine can be used to reset any information 
00192     * needed by the solution method that is particular to the hierarchy 
00193     * configuration.  For example, the solution procedure may cache 
00194     * communication schedules to amortize the cost of data movement on the 
00195     * AMR patch hierarchy.  This function will be called by the gridding 
00196     * algorithm after the initialization occurs so that the algorithm-specific
00197     * subclass can reset such things.  Also, if the solution method must 
00198     * make the solution consistent across multiple levels after the hierarchy 
00199     * is changed, this process may be invoked by this routine.  Of course the 
00200     * details of these processes are determined by the particular solution 
00201     * methods in use.
00202     *
00203     * The level number arguments indicate the coarsest and finest levels
00204     * in the current hierarchy configuration that have changed.  It should
00205     * be assumed that all intermediate levels have changed as well.
00206     */
00207    virtual void resetHierarchyConfiguration(
00208       const Pointer<BasePatchHierarchy<NDIM> > hierarchy,
00209       const int coarsest_level,
00210       const int finest_level);
00211 
00212    /*!*
00213     * Set tags to the specified tag value where refinement of the given
00214     * level should occur using the user-supplied gradient detector.  The 
00215     * value "tag_index" is the index of the cell-centered integer tag
00216     * array on each patch in the hierarchy.  The boolean argument indicates 
00217     * whether cells are being tagged on the level for the first time; 
00218     * i.e., when the hierarchy is initially constructed.  If it is false, 
00219     * it should be assumed that cells are being tagged at some later time 
00220     * after the patch hierarchy was initially constructed.  This information
00221     * is provided since the application of the error estimator may be 
00222     * different in each of those circumstances.
00223     */
00224    virtual void 
00225    applyGradientDetector(const Pointer<BasePatchHierarchy<NDIM> > hierarchy,
00226                          const int level_number,
00227                          const double time,
00228                          const int tag_index,
00229                          const bool initial_time,
00230                          const bool uses_richardson_extrapolation_too);

00247    /*!*
00248     * Perform user-defined refining operations.  This member function
00249     * is called before the other refining operators.  The preprocess
00250     * function should refine data from the scratch components of the
00251     * coarse patch into the scratch components of the fine patch on the
00252     * specified fine box region.  This version of the preprocess function
00253     * operates on a a single box at a time.  The user must define this
00254     * routine in the subclass.
00255     */
00256    virtual void preprocessRefine(
00257       Patch<NDIM>& fine,
00258       const Patch<NDIM>& coarse,
00259       const Box<NDIM>& fine_box,
00260       const IntVector<NDIM>& ratio)
00261       {
00262          (void) fine;
00263          (void) coarse;
00264          (void) fine_box;
00265          (void) ratio;
00266       }
00267 
00268    /*!*
00269     * Perform user-defined refining operations.  This member function
00270     * is called after the other refining operators.  The postprocess
00271     * function should refine data from the scratch components of the
00272     * coarse patch into the scratch components of the fine patch on the
00273     * specified fine box region.  This version of the postprocess function
00274     * operates on a a single box at a time.  The user must define this
00275     * routine in the subclass.
00276     */
00277    virtual void postprocessRefine(
00278       Patch<NDIM>& fine,
00279       const Patch<NDIM>& coarse,

00281       const IntVector<NDIM>& ratio)

00286          (void) ratio;

00293     */
00294    virtual IntVector<NDIM> getRefineOpStencilWidth() const
00295    {
00296       return(IntVector<NDIM>(0));
